author: cnbc.com
title: On February 11th Trophy Automotive Dealer Group (TADG) Hosted A Star-Studded Celebration Benefiting Make A Wish Foundation®
text:
Los Angeles, CA, Feb. 20, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- For Immediate Release: February 20, 2018
Trophy Automotive Dealer Group CEO, Mr. Nasser Water (L) and family
Legends of Tomorrow star Jes Macallan
Press/Media Contact: Tad Hamilton
Mosaic Public Relations
323-424-7499
Email: tad@mosaicpublicrelations.com
On February 11 th Trophy Automotive Dealer Group (TADG) Hosted A Star-Studded Celebration Benefiting Make A Wish Foundation ®
Los Angeles, CA – February 20, 2018 – On Sunday February 11 th Trophy Automotive Dealer Group (TADG) hosted “A Trophy Celebration” in honor of the company’s expansion of 4 new dealerships, namely, Mercedes-Benz of Valencia, Kia Downtown Los Angeles, West Covina Nissan and Universal City Nissan as well as to raise money for The Make A Wish foundation®. The guests were treated to a silent auction (with all proceeds going to Make A Wish Foundation®), live musical performances, magicians, Brazilian dancers, cigar patio and food and beverages for a crowd of over a thousand invited guests, celebrities, influencers, LA County Officials, global automotive manufacturing representatives and dealership VIP clients. This invite-only exclusive gala had a star-studded attendance which includes celebrities such as, Orange is the New Black’s Kimiko Glenn, The Originals Taylor Cole, Scandal’s Guillermo Diaz and Khandi Alexander, Days of Our Lives’ Camila Banus, Legends of Tomorrow’s Jes McCallan, Emmy winning Born This Way’s John Tucker, Sean McElwee and Caley Versfelt, Shameless’ Scott Michael Campbell, SAG Award winner Josh Sussman (Glee), and other notable celebrity guests that included Ken Davitian, Felix Solis, comedian Tehran, Juan Pablo Espinosa, Haley Sales, Trina McGee, Naomi Grossman, Emily and Elizabeth Hinkler, Jay Abdo, Leanne Lapp, Malcolm David Kelly, JD Ostojic, Catherine Lough Haggquist, Olden Polynice, Alexander Burke, Richard Fairgray, Rachel Sterling, Damian Whitewood and many more.
Nasser Watar, Chairman & CEO of Trophy Automotive Dealer Group LLC stated regarding Sunday’s celebration: “Today is the first major step that we take to demonstrate our strong commitment to support the local community and children in particular, which is why we have decided to partner with Make a Wish Foundation LA in their mission to grant the wishes of children with life-threatening medical conditions to enrich the human experience with hope, strength and joy. This charity epitomizes what we strive to do: make lives a bit hopeful for those children who need a smile and some happiness in times of need. We are so grateful for the opportunity to support them today and hope that we can raise some funds for them during tonight’s event too.”
TADG has plans to acquire more dealerships and become one of the largest dealer groups in the country. They plan to differentiate themselves from their competitors by being employee focused, innovative, creative and outside of the box thinkers. Each client will experience a one-of-a-kind, and uniquely individualized, experience once they enter any of the dealerships’ showrooms. Mr. Watar is Quote: d as saying: “TADG has been represented in the market with one of the top performing Mercedes-Benz dealerships in the nation and we are excited to expand our automotive footprint in the Los Angeles area with these acquisitions, making us one of the largest automotive dealer groups in the state of California in number of vehicles sold. With our Group’s focus to support customers throughout the car buying process from start to finish, TADG provides customers with the necessary information in a transparent manner to assist in making an informed car buying decision.”
Mr. Watar continues with “Our key priority and a pillar of our business is to ensure that we deliver a class-leading Customer Ownership Experience, from the first time a customer interacts with our dealerships, whether online or in person, and throughout each customer’s journey with their vehicle. Training & Development of our staff will be a key area, in order to ensure every TADG employee is equipped with all the tools to provide customers with the care and experience they deserve when going through the important decision of purchasing a new vehicle.” In addition to new vehicle sales, TADG will also focus on the used cars division and after-sales service experience to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction.
“These new acquisitions are part of our growth plan and our expectation is that our acquisition will see these dealerships also become trophy dealerships in sales and total customer experience. Furthermore, I would like to thank all of those that assisted us during the process of this acquisition especially the OEMs, our acquisition staff and employees of the dealerships that are part of the acquisition,” said Mr. Watar. “I’m confident that TADG will focus on delivering each brand’s respective brand promise and provide unparalleled customer satisfaction and total customer experience through innovative solutions and we are excited for the new opportunities to come,” said Mr. Watar.
The recipient of the evening’s silent auction, Make-A-Wish Foundation, ® grants the wishes of children with life-threatening medical conditions to enrich the human experience with hope, strength and joy. Based in Phoenix, the Make-A-Wish Foundation® is one of the nation's leading charities, serving children in every community in the United States, Puerto Rico and Guam. With the help of generous donors and approximately 25,000 volunteers nationwide, the Make-A-Wish Foundation® grants a wish every 38 minutes, on average. Since their inception in 1980, they have granted more than 226,000 wishes. Visit the Make-A-Wish Foundation of America at www.wish.org ( http://www.wish.org ) and discover how you can share the power of a wish®.
